alert.note: Alert for Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 08 at 8:52AM MST until January 08 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph creating blowing and drifting snow along with reduced visibility to one quarter mile or less. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood. * WHEN...Until 7 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on snow packed or icy road conditions. This includes portions of I-40 from Edgewood through Tijeras Canyon. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the Monday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
